text: "Apples and Bananas" is an instrumental composition released by Lawrence Welk and His Orchestra in 1965. The single spent 4 weeks on the Billboard Hot 100 chart, peaking at No. 75,Hot 100 - Lawrence Welk & His Orchestra Apples and Bananas Chart History, Billboard.com. Retrieved April 23, 2018."Billboard Hot 100", Billboard, April 24, 1965. Accessed July 27, 2016. while reaching No. 17 on Billboards Middle-Road Singles chart."Middle-Road Singles", Billboard, April 24, 1965. p. 23. Accessed July 27, 2016.Adult Contemporary - Lawrence Welk & His Orchestra Apples and Bananas Chart History, Billboard.com. Retrieved April 23, 2018. "Apples and Bananas" was most successful in Chicago, where it reached No. 11 on WLS's "Silver Dollar Survey"."WLS Silver Dollar Survey", WLS, March 26, 1965. Accessed July 27, 2016. "Apples and Bananas" was the lead song of an album by the same name released by Lawrence Welk and His Orchestra in 1965, which spent 12 weeks on Billboards chart of Top LPs,"Billboard Top LP's", Billboard, July 7, 1965. Accessed July 27, 2016. peaking at No. 57.Billboard 200 - Lawrence Welk Apples & Bananas, Billboard.com. Retrieved April 23, 2018."Billboard Top LP's", Billboard, June 26, 1965. Accessed July 27, 2016. ==Chart performance== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !align="left"|Chart (1965) ! style="text-align:center;"|Peak position |- |align="left"|US Billboard Hot 100 | style="text-align:center;"|75 |- |align="left"|US Billboard Middle-Road Singles | style="text- align:center;"|17 |} ==References== Category:1965 singles Category:Dot Records singles Category:Pop instrumentals
title: Apples and Bananas (instrumental)
